item.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula
item.description:
The movie is bleeding the world of darkness. Indeed, if one lets their mind see the word “undead” without clich√©, then it’s apparent how unnaturally opposite to the dead it must be.

Initially I was skeptical, but then I accepted the primal currency. Instead of being elaborate and artificial, it goes after natural, raw, and super-natural. And it is fundamentally flawed, yet fundamentally true. But once you have accepted the language of senses, the mind is bound to go mute.
